designScenario.name: Fuel Filtration System
designScenario.description: A critical subsystem within the aircraft fuel system designed to remove particulate contaminants, water, and microbial growth from aviation fuel. It ensures engine protection by maintaining fuel purity across all flight phases while operating under variable pressure, temperature, and flow conditions. The system employs multi-stage filtration with fail-safe mechanisms to comply with SAE AS4059 and ICAO fuel cleanliness standards.

details.description: Must remove particles ≥10 microns with 99.9% efficiency and separate free water from fuel to prevent ice formation and microbial growth.
Maintain maximum differential pressure of 0.25 Bar at rated flow capacity (3000 L/hour) to prevent fuel starvation.
Automatic bypass valve activation at 0.35 Bar differential pressure to ensure uninterrupted fuel flow during filter clogging.
Designed for 1000-hour service intervals with quick-disconnect filter elements meeting 5-minute replacement time criteria.

systemComponents.name: Primary Fuel Filter
systemComponents.description: First-stage stainless steel mesh filter capturing large particulates (>50 microns) and water droplets through centrifugal separation

subComponents.name: Swirl Generator
subComponents.description: Imparts rotational velocity to fuel for centrifugal water separation

subComponents.name: Coalescer Media
subComponents.description: Glass fiber matrix combining particle capture and water coalescence

systemComponents.name: Secondary Micronic Filter
systemComponents.description: Beta-rated pleated cellulose/polyester composite filter for sub-micron particle removal (β₅≥200)

subComponents.name: Filter Element
subComponents.description: ISO 2941-certified collapse-resistant media with end-of-life indicator

subComponents.name: Drain Valve
subComponents.description: Electro-pneumatic valve for accumulated water evacuation

systemComponents.name: Differential Pressure Sensor
systemComponents.description: Redundant strain gauge sensors measuring pressure drop across filter stages

systemComponents.name: Bypass Valve Assembly
systemComponents.description: Spring-loaded poppet valve with manual override for emergency flow path selection

subComponents.name: Actuator
subComponents.description: Precision-calibrated Belleville washer stack for threshold pressure response

systemComponents.name: Filter Health Monitoring Unit
systemComponents.description: Avionics-grade computer analyzing pressure trends and predicting filter lifespan

subComponents.name: Condition Monitoring Module
subComponents.description: Implements Weibull analysis for remaining useful life calculations

relationships.description: Primary filter output is directly plumbed to secondary filter input through rigid fuel lines forming an integrated filtration stack
Sensor array feeds real-time pressure data to the monitoring unit for system health analysis
Bypass valve activation logic depends on pressure differential measurements from redundant sensors
Shares filter status data with the main fuel control system via ARINC 429 databus
Filter outlet connects directly to fuel pump inlet, requiring pressure stability to prevent pump cavitation

attributes.name: filtrationEfficiency
attributes.description: Minimum particle capture efficiency at critical particle size per SAE AS4059 Class 3

attributes.name: maxPressureDrop
attributes.description: Allowed differential pressure across clean filter element at rated flow

attributes.name: flowCapacity
attributes.description: Maximum sustained flow rate at 40°C fuel temperature

attributes.name: operatingTempRange
attributes.description: Qualified temperature envelope covering ground and flight operations

attributes.name: maintenanceInterval
attributes.description: Scheduled filter replacement interval under normal operating conditions

comments.body: Primary filtration system for aviation fuel
